fields.description:
*Assessment*

euscale-describe-launch-configurations fails to display user-data variable if present.  The only way to display this information is by using the --debug flag.
{code}
[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-launch-configs --region devops-admin@region-1 --show-long
LAUNCH-CONFIG	NginxConfig	emi-b87dbd02	m1.medium					nginx-sg	2015-09-21T15:13:24.688Z	true	arn:aws:autoscaling::000693176866:launchConfiguration:03b2219d-227f-48c7-85a6-5077795b83a4:launchConfigurationName/NginxConfig

[root@c-02 ~]# euscale-describe-launch-configs --region devops-admin@region-1 --show-long --debug
2015-09-21 18:41:38,186 DEBUG   DescribeLaunchConfigurations parsed arguments: {'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': 'devops-admin@region-1', 'show_long': True, 'LaunchConfigurationNames.member': [], 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None}
2015-09-21 18:41:38,186 INFO    Config finding region option autoscaling-url
2015-09-21 18:41:38,186 DEBUG   Config   section region-1
2015-09-21 18:41:38,186 INFO    Config   found   region-1::autoscaling-url = 'http://autoscaling.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/'
2015-09-21 18:41:38,186 INFO    Config finding region option name
2015-09-21 18:41:38,186 DEBUG   Config   section region-1

2015-09-21 18:41:38,186 INFO    Config finding global option max-retries

2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 DEBUG   Config   section region-1
2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 DEBUG   Config   section *
2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 INFO    Config   novalue for verify-ssl
2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 INFO    Config finding user option key-id
2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 DEBUG   Config   section devops-admin
2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 INFO    Config   found   devops-admin::key-id = 'AKIAANXKTA7S6ITLUYGX'
2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 INFO    Config finding user option secret-key
2015-09-21 18:41:38,187 DEBUG   Config   section devops-admin

2015-09-21 18:41:38,196 DEBUG   HmacV4Auth scope: 20150922/region-1/autoscaling/aws4_request

2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Content-Length: 54
2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: Host: autoscaling.c-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773
2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: User-Agent: euca2ools/3.3.0-pre1-2-gcbbc0e7 (CPython 2.6.6; Linux 2.6.32-573.3.1.el6.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.3.4 requests/2.6.0
2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: X-Amz-Content-SHA256: e858e902d9287f6cedec21fa27ca23bda00820e3ffa25f3eac1929c4a84f423d
2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request header: X-Amz-Date: 20150922T014138Z
2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   Action: DescribeLaunchConfigurations
2015-09-21 18:41:38,198 DEBUG   AutoScaling request data:   Version: 2011-01-01
2015-09-21 18:41:38,236 DEBUG   AutoScaling response time: 0.037 seconds
2015-09-21 18:41:38,236 INFO    AutoScaling response status: 200
2015-09-21 18:41:38,236 DEBUG   AutoScaling response header: content-length: 1773
2015-09-21 18:41:38,236 DEBUG   AutoScaling response header: content-type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8
2015-09-21 18:41:38,236 DEBUG   AutoScaling response header: date: Tue, 22 Sep 2015 01:41:38 UTC
2015-09-21 18:41:38,237 DEBUG   DescribeLaunchConfigurations -- response content --
<DescribeLaunchConfigurationsResponse xmlns="http://autoscaling.amazonaws.com/doc/2011-01-01/"><DescribeLaunchConfigurationsResult><LaunchConfigurations><member><LaunchConfigurationName>NginxConfig</LaunchConfigurationName><LaunchConfigurationARN>arn:aws:autoscaling::000693176866:launchConfiguration:03b2219d-227f-48c7-85a6-5077795b83a4:launchConfigurationName/NginxConfig</LaunchConfigurationARN><ImageId>emi-b87dbd02</ImageId><SecurityGroups><member>nginx-sg</member></SecurityGroups><UserData></UserData><InstanceType>m1.medium</InstanceType><InstanceMonitoring><Enabled>true</Enabled></InstanceMonitoring><CreatedTime>2015-09-21T15:13:24.688Z</CreatedTime></member></LaunchConfigurations></DescribeLaunchConfigurationsResult><ResponseMetadata><RequestId>ef420bae-bb01-4a7d-9d4f-05cd1f997cc7</RequestId></ResponseMetadata></DescribeLaunchConfigurationsResponse>
2015-09-21 18:41:38,237 DEBUG   DescribeLaunchConfigurations -- end of response content --
LAUNCH-CONFIG	NginxConfig	emi-b87dbd02	m1.medium					nginx-sg	2015-09-21T15:13:24.688Z	true	arn:aws:autoscaling::000693176866:launchConfiguration:03b2219d-227f-48c7-85a6-5077795b83a4:launchConfigurationName/NginxConfig
{code}

This differs from the behavior of AWS CLI:
{code}
$ aws autoscaling describe-launch-configurations --profile hspencer-personal --output json
{
    "LaunchConfigurations": [
        {
            "UserData": "",
            "EbsOptimized": false,
            "LaunchConfigurationARN": "arn:aws:autoscaling:us-east-1:986451091583:launchConfiguration:76047e30-ee48-4b22-ace3-d5150ce2c83b:launchConfigurationName/NginxConfig",
            "InstanceMonitoring": {
                "Enabled": true
            },
            "ClassicLinkVPCSecurityGroups": [],
            "CreatedTime": "2015-09-22T01:38:34.191Z",
            "BlockDeviceMappings": [],
            "KeyName": "hspencer-test",
            "SecurityGroups": [
                "default"
            ],
            "LaunchConfigurationName": "NginxConfig",
            "KernelId": "",
            "RamdiskId": "",
            "ImageId": "ami-ad760bc8",
            "InstanceType": "m3.medium"
        }
    ]
}
{code}
fields.summary: euscale-describe-launch-configurations does not display user-data variable

comments.body: Could you, please, provide an example of output that you're looking for? This can result in a large amount of data.

Not quite -- euscale-describe-launch-configurations doesn't use JSON as its output format.  The reason it doesn't show user-data now is because they tend to be quite lengthy, which would render that command's one-config-per-line output format unusable.

What if we added an option similar to euare-userlistcerts's -v option that would explicitly tell it to show user-data after each launch configuration?  Then it would be clear that one is ready to handle output that is formatted that way and it wouldn't have to do any sort of encoding shenanigans to try to force it to stay on one line.

[~gholms],

I used the {{--output json}} option here as an example.  The option I have defined in my config file is text:
{code}
$ aws autoscaling describe-launch-configurations --profile hspencer-personal
LAUNCHCONFIGURATIONS	2015-09-22T01:38:34.191Z	False	ami-ad760bc8	m3.medium		hspencer-test	arn:aws:autoscaling:us-east-1:986451091583:launchConfiguration:76047e30-ee48-4b22-ace3-d5150ce2c83b:launchConfigurationName/NginxConfig	NginxConfig		
INSTANCEMONITORING	True
SECURITYGROUPS	default
{code}

With regards to having the -v option, I think that would hit the nail on the head.  Goal really is to see if user-data is actually defined with a given autoscaling group launch configuration.  Right now, there really isn't a way to tell in the default output of 'euscale-describe-launch-configurations'.  Hope this helps.
Since euscale-describe-launch-configs already has a --show-long option I added user-data output to that in commit {{0bcdd1a}}.

*Euca2ools Version*

{{3.3.1-0.1839.51.20161208gita195aac.el7}}

*Steps*

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.3.2 cloud with VPC - [hspencer-208|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Maint-4.3/208/]
# Set up non-eucalyptus account
# Using Ubuntu Xenial cloud image, created a cloudformation stack using the linked {{cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-noaz-template.json}} template:
{code}
[root@d-14 ~]# euform-validate-template --template-file cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-noaz-template.json --region qa-admin@drake
DESCRIPTION	CloudFormation template to launch a highly available Nginx web stack in Eucalyptus VPC
PARAMETER	ImageId	false		Ubuntu Image id
PARAMETER	KeyName	false		Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instances
PARAMETER	InstanceType	false	m1.xlarge	Type of EC2 instance to launch.
PARAMETER	MinSize	false	2	Minimum number of EC2 instances.
PARAMETER	MaxSize	false	4	Maximum number of EC2 instances.

[root@d-14 ~]# euform-create-stack NginxStack --parameter ImageId=emi-08b81c27 --parameter KeyName=qa-admin --parameter InstanceType=m1.small --template-file cfn-elb-cloudwatch-vpc-noaz-template.json --region qa-admin@drake
arn:aws:cloudformation::001769317121:stack/NginxStack/82829e7a-a7ed-432f-b971-0bebcd4acf48
[root@d-14 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region qa-admin@drake
STACK	NginxStack	CREATE_COMPLETE		CloudFormation template to launch a highly available Nginx web stack in Eucalyptus VPC	2016-12-12T07:38:19.092Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-08b81c27
PARAMETER	KeyName		qa-admin
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.small
PARAMETER	MinSize		2
PARAMETER	MaxSize		4
OUTPUT	ELBURL	http://NginxStac-NginxELB-IMOKBZLTYFUS6-001769317121.lb.h-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
{code}
# Listed the ASG launch configs, passing the {{\--show-long}} flag:
{code}
[root@d-14 ~]# euscale-describe-launch-configs --region qa-admin@drake
LAUNCH-CONFIG	NginxStack-LaunchConfig-HUHD42X0W4H2S	emi-08b81c27	m1.small
[root@d-14 ~]# euscale-describe-launch-configs --region qa-admin@drake --show-long
LAUNCH-CONFIG	NginxStack-LaunchConfig-HUHD42X0W4H2S	emi-08b81c27	m1.small	qa-admin				sg-cf495ca6	2016-12-12T07:38:44.781Z	true	arn:aws:autoscaling::001769317121:launchConfiguration:f3b8849c-f933-4cf9-8ba0-7a0078004528:launchConfigurationName/NginxStack-LaunchConfig-HUHD42X0W4H2S				true
USER-DATA	NginxStack-LaunchConfig-HUHD42X0W4H2S
#cloud-config
apt_update: true
disable_root: true
packages:
 - less
runcmd:
 - [ apt-get, install, -y, --force-yes, nginx ]


{code}
